title: Bug 9619: Move static member - Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619: Move static member - Dialog details 20020212a.

Mnemonics.
No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for superclass), so it could be done. At least isValidTypeName.
Label could say 'Select destination type:'.

Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Destination type can be source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
OB:
Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Destination type can be source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
EB:
The browse button should be of standard size using SWTUtil.
When going to the next page, the title should not display 'Type not found'.
Types shown in the dialog should only be from the source folders of the own project.
The refactoring should not warn about resulting errors or make pseudo-changes in all referencing classes when the destination type is the same as the source type.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the dialog for moving a static member.
2. Observe that the browse button is too small.
3. Proceed to the next page and observe that the title says 'Type not found'.
4. Check that types from other projects or folders are shown in the dialog.
5. Attempt to move the static member to the same type and check if the refactoring warning appears and pseudo-changes are made in all referencing classes.
